result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel D. Hughes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:01 a.m. Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court with attorney Thomas Garrett Wilmouth.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15tr980, 15tr3119, 15tr3120, 15cf282, 15cf287, 15cm127, 15ct45. Schiek states global resolution - Wilmouth in agreement. State moves to dismiss but read in - Counts 1, 2, 4, 6, 7 and 8 in 15cf287, all counts in 15cm127, all counts in 15ct45, all counts in 15cf282 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 15tr980, 15tr3119 and 15tr3120 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea to Counts 3 and 5 in 15cf287.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek statement to victim notification in 15cf282 - no restitution figure provided by victim. Schiek moves for restitution figure in 15cf282 to be provided within 30 days and included as part of the judgment in 15cf287.  Wilmouth has no objections. Schiek/Wilmouth/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence -
Count 3
WHS/POP - 4 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given.

Count 5
WHS/POP - 1 year
Costs
Jail credit - 156 days on both counts if revoked

Cash bond to be held until restitution is determined or will be applied to court costs. Cash bond held for 30 days - if no notification regarding restitution - to be applied to costs. Wilmouth to have 5 days to object to restitution amount. 
Adj. 11:23 am

Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court with attorney Thomas Garrett Wilmouth.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:10
Calling 15cf282,15cm27,15ct45,15tr980 and 15tr3119,15cf287
Schiek  statement to status of case - victim notification - restitution amount  just provided - request adjournment 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court with attorney Thomas Wilmouth.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 15tr980, 15tr3119, 15tr3120, 15cf282, 15cm127, 15ct45. Wilmouth requests pre-trial conference. Bail continued. Adj. 3:30 p.m. Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
to allow withdrawal of attorney  - includes cover letter

2:07 p.m. Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder. Mary Margaret Sowinski, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CF282, 15CM127,15TR3120, 15TR980, 15TR3119, 15CT45. Snyder states that he has been discharged. PD office looking to appoint new counsel. Court grants Snyder request. Court speaks to defendant regarding appointment of counsel. Hughes statement. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:10 p.m. Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant Joel D. Hughes in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15tr3120, 15tr980, 15ct45, 15cf282, 15cf287, 15cm127, 15cf282 and 15cf287. Snyder - offer has been made by State - has not had a chance to discuss with client. Schiek/Snyder/Defendant statement on motion to modify bond. Bail continued. Adj. 2:20 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

2:55 p.m. Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant Joel D. Hughes in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm127, 15ct45, 15cf282, 15cf287, 15tr3120, 15tr3119, 15tr980.  In 15cf282 and 15cf287 Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Information received in both CF cases - waive reading - enter not guilty pleas. Snyder motion to modify bond to lift no abusive contact with C. Rahlf - Bendar statement - Court will hold off on decision until no contact provision is signed by all necessary parties. Snyder moves to modify bond to obtain treatment at Koinonia - no objection from State - Court allows ability to go to Koinonia if bed becomes available - if successfully completes treatment program - credit will be given. Adj. 3:02 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:44 p.m. Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court via video with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Defendant Joel D. Hughes in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm127, 15cf282, 15cf287, 15tr980, 15tr3119, and 15tr3120.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing -  Snyder motion to bond/Bednar statement as to bond. In 15cf282 and 15cf287, Court modifies $5000 cash bond total - $2,500 for each case-nonmonetary conditions to remain same. 
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

2:58 pm Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm127, 15ct45, and 15tr980. Burns states DOT said it would 21 days to obtain license. Bail continued. Adj. 2:59 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 11:00 am. Adj. 3:00 p.m.

02:00 pm - Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15tr980, 15cm127 and 15ct45.  Schiek states defendant eligible to reinstate DL in 30 days - requests adjournment.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Adj. 02:01 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:47 pm - Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15ct45, 15cm127 anmd 15tr980.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

03:17 pm - Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15tr980, 15cm127 and 15ct45.  Defendant states contacted PD and was found eligible.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joel D. Hughes
Current: 210 Highview Parkway, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2015)
Prior: 1016 S. 3rd, Wausau, WI 54401

01:21 pm - GBA for PFO - Defendant Joel D. Hughes in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15ct45 and 15cm127.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
